channel.title: [Delphi]Idea please / Added question!
channel.description:
Well, I have found out that the only way I can really learn a language (either programming or talking) Is by writing it. So I need a medium idea that I can work on. And you are the one that is going to give me the idea :D It doesn't have to be usefull, but nothing Runescape related please (as in no autoer). If you make it too hard for me, be aware that I will flood this forum with questions :P
Thanks in advance.
Edit: Please answer my question I posted on reply #9.

item.title: [Delphi]Idea please / Added question!
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

No, you need to create a new webbrowser object for each tab.
Something like this:

wb:= TWebBrowser.create(panel);
with wb do begin
parent:= panel;
align:= alclient;
//any other settings
end;

Read full topic

item.title: [Delphi]Idea please / Added question!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Ok, I got the tabs almost working. But I have a question about them. I use buttons as tabs (I know there are other methods, but I like it) Do I need to make a new panel with a Webbrowser component for each tab, or can I somehow create a new page using the same Webbrowser component? So when you click ‘New tab’ you get a new page.

Thanks in advance.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delphi]Idea please / Added question!
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

If your going to make a web browser, look into using the Gecko layout engine, so your browser can actually be standards compliant.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delphi]Idea please / Added question!
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Then add a tabbed interface, the ability to save your tab session, a history categorized in a TreeView, etc… There are an endless numbers of things you can add. Don’t just make the basics.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delphi]Idea please / Added question!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

A webbrowser using the IE component is quite easy. I made one but it’s quite easy. Making it a stand alone one is harder thoug, I’ll try that someday.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delphi]Idea please / Added question!
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Make something you find to be neat, or even better, make something you find to be useful.
These things are different for everyone.
Web browsers are always a popular item.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delphi]Idea please / Added question!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Oman, why not make a batch IDE :P. I know a parser is a bit more usefull, but I can try to make the parser a part the IDE. Quite useless but educating.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delphi]Idea please / Added question!
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:3, topic:139218”]I have no idea what you mean lol.[/quote]dont worry, he doesnt either

dont attempt to write a language, in order for it to be even slightly usable you have to learn a hell of a lot, all of which is above 99.9999% of people on this forum.

however, you could attempt to make some sort of interpreted scripting language, eg. a batch file parser

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:1, topic:139218”]but nothing Runescape related please (as in no autoer).[/quote]you are on a runescape cheating forum, one would hope that is what the majority of suggestions would be…

Read full topic

item.title: [Delphi]Idea please / Added question!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Microsoft Foundation Class Library? I have no idea what you mean lol. Explain what it is :o
